intro: Euphrasia paghmanensis, commonly known as the Paghman eyebright, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Scrophulariaceae family and is characterized by its small, yellowish-orange flowers with prominent yellow spots. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils at high altitudes, showcasing its adaptability to harsh environments. Its leaves are opposite and ovate, often covered in fine hairs, while its stems are erect and branched. Euphrasia paghmanensis is valued for its potential medicinal properties, though further research is needed to confirm its therapeutic uses.
